cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north then north-northeast, cross the northern Gulf Coast late Wednesday, and accelerate across the Southeast U.S. toward the Mid-Atlantic coast Thursday night–Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (between Morgan City LA and the Mississippi/Alabama border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City Louisiana to the Mississippi/Alabama border; Storm Surge Warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River LA to Navarre FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast, then inland across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic including Virginia coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 kt) possible Thursday afternoon through late evening as the center passes nearby.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (generally <2 ft) possible in Chesapeake Bay and adjacent rivers.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts could cause urban and small-stream flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief isolated tornado risk Thursday; rough seas and hazardous marine conditions.
